author: Gamers Nexus
description:
Sponsor: Thermaltake TR100 mini-ITX Travel Case on Amazon https://geni.us/Yn9DXb
ASUS' decisions to force unwanted software onto users has put them at risk, like with Armoury Crate, MyASUS and DriverHub, and even its "AI" security features in its routers. We sought peer review from a security researcher, Paul (aka "Mr Bruh"), to dig into the topics of ASUS' vulnerabilities and exploits. If you have ASUS software installed, you should think about removing it -- and you should minimally update it. Likewise, be careful of what data you feed into ASUS' RMA and warranty system.

Grab the Honey Pot T-Shirt: https://store.gamersnexus.net/products/honey-pot-foil-tshirt-100pct-cotton-limited
The best way to support our work is through our store: https://store.gamersnexus.net/

ASUS scammed us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7pMrssIrKcY
ASUS face-to-face on warranties: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z0ZoCYXmF0Q
Watch our WinRing 0 security report: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H_O5JtBqODA
title: The ASUS Dumpster Fire
